page.title: 13The Mining Industry.
page.content: Since Roman times there have been mines in the area of Snailbeach and Stiperstones.Recent mining began from around 1760,but the most intensive period of working was in the middle of the 19th.Century.By 1910 almost all mining had finished but continued on a small scale until the 1950's.So far 28 mine shafts have been found and filled.There were quanties of zinc and barytes found in the mines and there is still lead.There are horizontal tunnels called adits for the men to enter the mines and the shafts were used for lowering the buckets down to collect the minerals.The mines are visited a lot by tourists.In a survey of local opinion we found that a few people would like the mining industry revived, but a lot of people said no. The majority of the local people are in favour of a small mining museum.
